text: look at these cute little pinky buns and
they're so cute
super soft and fluffy on the outside and
melting rich on the inside with that
cream cheese custard filling better yet
you don't even need any artificial food
coloring to make them let me show you
how let's start making the fillings
first you will need 240 gram of cream
cheese 50 grams sugar 1 egg yolk 100 ml
of whipping cream 200 ml of milk 25 gram
all-purpose flour 10 gram cornstarch and
Telegram of butter combine the sugar and
cream cheese in a mixing bowl and whisk
until well combined remember to use the
cream cheese as room temperature so it's
easier to mix add one egg yolk
the whipping cream and milk mix well
[Music]
finally mix the a purpose flour with the
constat and sift into the cream cheese
mixture now bring it to the stove and
turn on the burner to the lowest setting
stir constantly so it won't burn at the
bottom keep stirring and cook under low
heat until you get a really thick and
creamy mixture transfer to a bowl then
add the butter and mix well cover the
bowl with plastic wrap making sure that
the wrap touches the surface of the
custard so it won't dry out leave to
cool and then chill in the refrigerator
the custard is now chilled and gets
thicker use an ice cream scoop to divide
the mixture into 16 equal portions place
them on a tray or a cutting board light
with some plastic wrap and then put into
the freezer for a couple of hours that
way it would be easier to shape the
dough for the pink bun you will need 500
gram all purpose flour 1 egg 80 gram of
powdered sugar 1 tablespoon of milk
powder fry gram of salt 10 gram of
instant yeast 100 gram of milk half a
red dragon fruit also known at ping
patria and for a 5 gram of butter or
veggie boy red dragon fruit is very rich
in vitamin C that's where we get the
pink color for the bun without using any
artificial coloring peel and cut into
cubes and puree now in a large mixing
bowl combine all the dry ingredients
including the octopus flour powdered
sugar milk powder and instant yeast and
salt then mix well and add the wet
ingredients including milk and the red
dragon fruit puree mix until well
combined and then add 45 grams butter at
room temperature
then leave with your hands or in a stand
mixer for about five to seven minutes
until the dough is no longer sticky and
you can stretch it out into a pretty
thin sheet like this that's great
now place the dough in a bowl and use
saran wrap to cover it proof the dough
at room temperature for about 45 minutes
or until it doubles in size when the
dough Rises double in size you can
remove and press to release the air and
then shape it into a lock and divide
into 6 equal portions take out one piece
and flatten it with a rolling pin making
sure that the outside rim is bigger than
the center now take out the feelings
from the freezer and place one piece in
the center pinch the edges together
making sure that you seal it properly
otherwise the filling is gonna leak out
when we bake place the suicide down on a
cupcake liner bake in the buns for about
17 to 20 minutes until done make sure
that you bake the buns at low
temperatures so that you can keep the
nice color of the buns if the
temperature is too high the bun will
turn golden brown and they will lose the
beautiful color wow look at them so cute
when the band comes down you can spread
the rest of the cream cheese on top
sprinkle some pop floss on top if you
wish the band is super mega soft and
fluffy and the cream cheese is melting
easy now's when you bite into it the
puff floss give us a really nice savory
flavor which is quite an Asian thing if
you don't like it you can skip it
totally you can keep these buns in the
fridge for about three days before
serving you can put them in a microwave
for about 10 seconds so it's soft and
the fillings is melting I hope you
enjoyed today's recipe share with me a
photo if you give it a try don't forget
to thumbs up and subscribe I will see
you the next time
[Music]
